div.l: And Gaylard was he / as a Goldfynche in the shawe
Broun as a bery a ꝓpropre short felawe
With lokkes blake / kembed full fetisely
Daunce he coude so wele and Iolely
That he was cleped / Perkyn revelour
He was full of loue and ꝑparamour
As is the hyve full of hony swete
Wele was the wenche / that with hym myght mete
At eủery bridale wolde he synge and hoppe
He loued bette the taverne / than the shoppe
For whan there any rydyng was in chepe
Oute of the shoppe / theder wolde he lepe
Til that he hadde all the sighte yseyn
And daunces wele / he wolde nat come a ge eyn gayn geyn
And gadred hym a meny of his sorte
To hoppe and synge / and made hym good disporte
And ther they steuen sette for to mete
To pley at dyse in suche a streete
For in the toun nas ther no prentise
That fairer coude caste a peire of dyse
Than Perkyn coude / and · and ther to he was free
Of his dispence in place of pryuete
That founde his maister wele in his chaffare
For ofte tymes he fonde his boxe full bare
For soothly a prentise a revelour
That haunteth dise riot and ꝑparamour
His maister shall it in his shoppe a bye
Al haue he no part of the Mynstralsie
For thefte and ryot ben conủertible
Al can he pley on gytern or ribible
Reuell and trouthe as in a lawe decree
They ben full wrooth / alday as memmemmen may see
This Ioly prentice / with his maister stoode
Til he was ny / oute of his prentishode
Al where he soped / booth erly and late
And somtyme ledde with reuel to newegate
But at the laste / his maister hym bythought
Vppon a day whan he his papir sought
Of a proủerbe that seith this same worde
